channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Reporters' notebook: The Olympics closing ceremony is way more fun than you'd think
item.description: Olympics opening ceremonies tend to get more love than their closing counterparts. But a pair of NPR reporters who watched both in Italy left with a newfound appreciation for the latter.
item.content:encoded:
Olympics opening ceremonies tend to get more love than their closing counterparts. But a pair of NPR reporters who watched both in Italy left with a newfound appreciation for the latter.

(Image credit: Piero Cruciatti)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: A new project excavates U.S. history with weekly essays on presidents and first ladies
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Colleen Shogan, former Archivist of the U.S., about an initiative to "debrief America" in its 250th year with essays by prominent Americans, starting with George W. Bush.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe talks to Colleen Shogan, former Archivist of the U.S., about an initiative to "debrief America" in its 250th year with essays by prominent Americans, starting with George W. Bush.
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Researchers built musical instruments out of vapes
item.description: Instead of throwing away your old vape, consider turning it into a musical instrument.
item.content:encoded: Instead of throwing away your old vape, consider turning it into a musical instrument.
item.dc:creator: Margaux Bauerlein

item.title: PHOTOS: Your car has a lot to say about who you are
item.description: Photographer Martin Roemer visited 22 countries — from the U.S. to Senegal to India — to show how our identities are connected to our mode of transportation.
item.content:encoded:
Photographer Martin Roemer visited 22 countries — from the U.S. to Senegal to India — to show how our identities are connected to our mode of transportation.

(Image credit: Martin Roemers)
item.dc:creator: Kamala Thiagarajan

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: TransformeR
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with listener Joan Suits and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with listener Joan Suits and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: FCC calls for more 'patriotic, pro-America' programming in run-up to 250th anniversary
item.description: The "Pledge America Campaign" urges broadcasters to focus on programming that highlights "the historic accomplishments of this great nation from our founding through the Trump Administration today."
item.content:encoded:
The "Pledge America Campaign" urges broadcasters to focus on programming that highlights "the historic accomplishments of this great nation from our founding through the Trump Administration today."

(Image credit: Mark Wilson)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Pin trading has taken over the Olympics. Here's what it's like in Milan
item.description: Pin trading has become a hallmark of the Olympics in recent decades — and not just for athletes. An official trading center in Milan was a hotspot for longtime collectors and curious newcomers alike.
item.content:encoded:
Pin trading has become a hallmark of the Olympics in recent decades — and not just for athletes. An official trading center in Milan was a hotspot for longtime collectors and curious newcomers alike.

(Image credit: Rachel Treisman)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for February 21, 2026: Welcome to the Wait Wait Olympic Games!
item.description: This week, we give out our own Olympic gold medals to some of our favorite guests and segments from the past year, with Roy Choi, Cynthia Nixon, Ally the Piper, and more!
item.content:encoded:
This week, we give out our own Olympic gold medals to some of our favorite guests and segments from the past year, with Roy Choi, Cynthia Nixon, Ally the Piper, and more!

(Image credit: Kristy Sparow)

item.title: In Berlin, there are movies, there's politics and there's talk about it all
item.description: Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.
item.content:encoded:
Buzz around whether the city's film festival would take a stance on the war in Gaza has dominated conversation in recent days.

(Image credit: John MacDougall)
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie

item.title: '10% Happier' author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. 10% Happier author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't talk about. 10% Happier author Dan Harris talks about a moment of kindness from a stranger.
